text:
Hi guys does the betfair Non-Interactive login required a self signed certificate as per <https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Non-Interactive+%28bot%29+login>????

I coded my login code back in 2014 which worked well and returned my Session ID (SSOID), however as I have continued to call the function Keep Betfair Alive <https://identitysso.betfair.com/api/keepAlive> I believe this function has been keeping my SSOID current and maybe I have missed Betfair have increased their login security ??   I changed my password the other day and then when the betbot try to login I get Errors.




Also slightly unrelated but does anyone here use the Betfair Developer Forum <https://forum.developer.betfair.com/> and can you login ?   I assume the login is your current betfair login but it just will not allow me to login to the forum yet I used to have access :disappointed:

text: If you have not changed code since 2014, I know they changed the URL of the login call several years ago?

text: Perhaps it's to do with your TLS version, the requirements were changed in 2019. See here <https://forum.developer.betfair.com/forum/developer-program/announcements/27206-betfair-api-login-tls-1-2-from-19th-february-2019>

attachments.fallback: Developer Program Forum: Betfair API Login - TLS 1.2 - from 19th February 2019 -              Developer Program Forum
attachments.text: Please be aware that from - 19th February, the only protocol for securing the communication between Betfair servers and web browsers at login will be TLS 1.2
attachments.title: Betfair API Login - TLS 1.2 - from 19th February 2019 -              Developer Program Forum

elements.text: Perhaps it's to do with your TLS version, the requirements were changed in 2019. See here

text: I've also had problems with older certificates and newer versions of SSL that decided that the encryption mechanism used to create the certificates is too weak. I had to make changes to ssl config files but ultimately ended up generating new certificates.

elements.text: I've also had problems with older certificates and newer versions of SSL that decided that the encryption mechanism used to create the certificates is too weak. I had to make changes to ssl config files but ultimately ended up generating new certificates.

text:
Thanks for the replies.  DC this login function was coded in 2014 but I did update it to include TLS 1.2 in 2019.

I get this response atm and I have printed to the console window using debug.print
Debug.Print(thePage.ResponseUri.Query) = ?redirectMethod=POST&errorCode=INPUT_VALIDATION_ERROR

I am also wondering whether this code is non-interactive OR is it interactive in that I am just passing in my login details and password however I am passing it through a HTTPWebRequest.  I guess once I received my session ID I have never had to look at this code again.


My code is below and thanks btw:

elements.text:
Thanks for the replies.  DC this login function was coded in 2014 but I did update it to include TLS 1.2 in 2019.

I get this response atm and I have printed to the console window using debug.print
Debug.Print(thePage.ResponseUri.Query) = ?redirectMethod=POST&errorCode=INPUT_VALIDATION_ERROR

I am also wondering whether this code is non-interactive OR is it interactive in that I am just passing in my login details and password however I am passing it through a HTTPWebRequest.  I guess once I received my session ID I have never had to look at this code again.


My code is below and thanks btw:

text:
Public Function LoginSessionBetfair(username As String, password As String) As String
        Dim ssoid As String = [String].Empty
        Dim info As String()
        Dim sessToken As String = ""
        LoginSessionBetfair = ""

        Try
            ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol = SecurityProtocolType.Tls12    'V0.40 12 March 2019 added as requested by Betfair

         Dim uri As String = String.Format("<https://identitysso.betfair.com/api/login?username={0}&password=>                          {1}&login=true&redirectMethod=POST&product=<http://home.betfair.int|home.betfair.int>&url=<https://www.betfair.com/>", username, password)
            Dim myRequest As HttpWebRequest = DirectCast(WebRequest.Create(uri), HttpWebRequest)

            myRequest.Method = "POST"
            myRequest.Timeout = 5000

            Dim thePage As WebResponse = myRequest.GetResponse()
            info = thePage.Headers.GetValues("Set-Cookie")
            Debug.Print(thePage.ResponseUri.Query) 'PRINT OUT WHY I MIGHT HAVE AN ERROR?


            Dim i As Integer = 0
            While ssoid = [String].Empty AndAlso i < info.Length
                If info(i).Contains("ssoid=") Then
                    ssoid = info(i)
                End If
                i += 1
            End While

            sessToken = ssoid.Replace("ssoid=", "") 'Dump front string
            sessToken = sessToken.Replace("; Domain=.<http://betfair.com|betfair.com>; Path=/; Secure", "")         'dump rear string

        Catch ex As System.Exception

        End Try

        Return sessToken '~~> Should work ok if Login a success
    End Function 'Session Token and Login

elements.text:

{1}&login=true&redirectMethod=POST&product=
home.betfair.int
&url=

", username, password)
            Dim myRequest As HttpWebRequest = DirectCast(WebRequest.Create(uri), HttpWebRequest)

            myRequest.Method = "POST"

            Dim thePage As WebResponse = myRequest.GetResponse()
            info = thePage.Headers.GetValues("Set-Cookie")

            Dim i As Integer = 0
            While ssoid = [String].Empty AndAlso i < info.Length
                If info(i).Contains("ssoid=") Then
                    ssoid = info(i)
                End If
                i += 1
            End While

            sessToken = ssoid.Replace("ssoid=", "") 'Dump front string
            sessToken = sessToken.Replace("; Domain=.
betfair.com

; Path=/; Secure", "")         'dump rear string

        Catch ex As System.Exception

        End Try

        Return sessToken '~~> Should work ok if Login a success
    End Function 'Session Token and Login

text:
Hmm ok so an update.  I placed a WebBrowser1 on my form then manually entered my login details - which fired the WebBrowser1_DocumentCompleted.  I then inspected the cookie to find  ssoid=PXVhiddenxxxxxxJI=; loggedIn=true etc.

I then called my BetfairKeepAlive Function passing in the ssoid session id and then after that I could the MarketCatalog and MarketBook.

text:
When I go back to my Betfair login function which is similar to this <https://forum.developer.betfair.com/forum/sports-exchange-api/net/26471-recent-vb-login-code>, I still get the

thePage.ResponseUri.Query = ?redirectMethod=POST&errorCode=INPUT_VALIDATION_ERROR

I also note that the INFO Variable contains 2 sort of sessions IDs and that it expires tomorrow?  However if looks different to the ssoid I had a few minutes ago which started  ssoid = PXVhiddenxxxxxxJI

text: I can only assume you are not even using the non-interactive login here as the endpoint for cert logins is "<https://identitysso-cert.betfair.com/api/certlogin>" . I'm not familiar with VB and associated components so I will tap out here.
